title: Using IUCN Spatial Data
text: Non-geometry columns extracted pure data.frame. may take run first time, subsequent runs quick results cached. Use filter species want evaluate.
code: features = habistats::iucn_spatial_features() |> print() #> # A tibble: 5 × 28 #>      id_no sci_name       presence origin seasonal compiler yrcompiled citation  #>      <int> <chr>             <int>  <int>    <int> <chr>         <int> <chr>     #> 1 19990904 Strato arctica        1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 2 20010425 Diva satanica         1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 3 20010425 Diva satanica         1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 4 19851118 Kai kiske             1      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> 5 19710604 Elp tarkus            5      1        1 NWOBHM         2025 habistats #> # ℹ 20 more variables: subspecies <chr>, subpop <chr>, source <lgl>, #> #   island <chr>, tax_comm <chr>, dist_comm <chr>, generalisd <int>, #> #   legend <chr>, kingdom <chr>, phylum <chr>, class <chr>, order_ <chr>, #> #   family <chr>, genus <chr>, category <chr>, marine <lgl>, terrestria <lgl>, #> #   freshwater <lgl>, SHAPE_Leng <dbl>, SHAPE_Area <dbl>  species = habistats::iucn_spatial_species() |> print() #> # A tibble: 4 × 11 #>   kingdom   phylum class order_ family genus sci_name category marine terrestria #>   <chr>     <chr>  <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>    <lgl>  <lgl>      #> 1 METALLICA CHORD… MAMM… CARNI… CANID… Stra… Strato … LC       FALSE  TRUE       #> 2 METALLICA CHORD… AVES  PASSE… CORVI… Diva  Diva sa… LC       FALSE  TRUE       #> 3 METALLICA TRACH… MAGN… CUCUR… CUCUR… Kai   Kai kis… LC       FALSE  TRUE       #> 4 METALLICA CHORD… MAMM… CINGU… CHLAM… Elp   Elp tar… EW       FALSE  TRUE       #> # ℹ 1 more variable: freshwater <lgl> sn = species |>   dplyr::filter(phylum == "CHORDATA") |>   dplyr::pull(sci_name) |>   print() #> [1] "Strato arctica" "Diva satanica"  "Elp tarkus"

title: Using IUCN Spatial Data
text: Split IUCN shape files separate gpkg files efficient processing. slow storage, may take run even non-first time.
code: species_gpkg = habistats::iucn_species_gpkg() |> print() #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   sci_name       source                                                          #>   <chr>          <fs::path>                                                      #> 1 Strato arctica …A/MAMMALIA/CARNIVORA/CANIDAE/Strato/Strato_arctica/source.gpkg #> 2 Diva satanica  …ATA/AVES/PASSERIFORMES/CORVIDAE/Diva/Diva_satanica/source.gpkg #> 3 Kai kiske      …OLIOPSIDA/CUCURBITALES/CUCURBITACEAE/Kai/Kai_kiske/source.gpkg #> 4 Elp tarkus     …A/MAMMALIA/CINGULATA/CHLAMYPHORIDAE/Elp/Elp_tarkus/source.gpkg

title: Using IUCN Spatial Data
text: may want save result file.
code: out = species_gpkg |>   dplyr::filter(sci_name %in% sn) |>   tibble::deframe() |>   quantify_vector_kgc() |>   print() #> # A tibble: 3 × 8 #>   name           perimeter       area abundance richness idx_shannon idx_simpson #>   <chr>              <dbl>      <dbl>     <int>    <int>       <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Strato arctica  3201738.    3.39e11      9157        3       0.486       0.703 #> 2 Diva satanica   6784114.    8.04e11     18038        5       0.932       0.443 #> 3 Elp tarkus      3854483.    2.49e11      4875        3       0.239       0.881 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: idx_brillouin <dbl> readr::write_tsv(out, "iucn_range.tsv.gz")

title: Species-level summary of IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_species
text: iucn_species_gpkg() splits IUCN shape files separate gpkg files species, returns paths. allows parallel processing downstream analysis, avoids need read large shape files . Use iucn_spatial_species() iucn_spatial_features() quick skimming whole dataset, determine species analyze.

title: Read and process IUCN Spatial Data — iucn_spatial_features
text: IUCN Spatial Data large collection shape files, package provides efficient ways read process . may take run first time, subsequent runs quick results cached. iucn_spatial_features() reads IUCN shape files drops geometry column. useful quick skimming whole dataset. Set habistats.iucn_source option specify path directory containing IUCN shape files, use iucn_source_path() check .

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: raster_kgc() gives easy access Köppen-Geiger climate classification raster data. can cropped given polygon. scale_color_kgc() scale_fill_kgc() ggplot2 color scales used KGC raster.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
code: raster_kgc(mask = NULL, keep_ocean = FALSE)  scale_color_kgc(...)  scale_fill_kgc(...)

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: stars object 2 dimensions 1 attribute.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: https://koeppen-geiger.vu-wien.ac.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: mask sf sfc object cropping. NULL (default), full raster returned. keep_ocean logical. FALSE (default), "Ocean" converted NA cropping. relevant mask NULL. ... passed ggplot2::scale_fill_manual().

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
text: raster_kgc() returns stars object. scale_color_kgc() scale_fill_kgc() return ggplot2 scale.

title: Köppen-Geiger Climate Classification — raster_kgc
code: library(ggplot2) geo_jp = rnaturalearth::ne_countries(country = "Japan") kgc_jp = habistats::raster_kgc(geo_jp, keep_ocean = TRUE) |> print() #> stars object with 2 dimensions and 1 attribute #> attribute(s): #>  KG_1986-2010.grd  #>  Cfa    : 3637     #>  Dfb    : 1689     #>  Cfb    :  307     #>  Ocean  :  151     #>  Dfc    :  150     #>  (Other):   31     #>  NA's   :28160     #> dimension(s): #>   from   to offset    delta refsys x/y #> x 3713 3907   -180  0.08333 WGS 84 [x] #> y  534  708     90 -0.08333 WGS 84 [y] ggplot(geo_jp) +   stars::geom_stars(data = kgc_jp) +   geom_sf(linewidth = 1, color = "#00000088", fill = NA) +   scale_fill_kgc(na.value = "transparent") +   theme_minimal()

what: Apply a function to each subset of a list. — lmap_lst
title: Apply a function to each subset of a list. — lmap_lst
text: lmap*() similar lapply(), map subset .x[] instead element .x[[]]. allows .f access attributes encapsulating list. useful operation sfc column sf data.frame. purrr::lmap() similar things, forces output list. mclmap*() parallelized versions lmap*().

title: Apply a function to each subset of a list. — lmap_lst
text: .x list. .f function apply subset .x. mode Output type. ... Additional arguments passed parallel::mclapply().

title: Rowwise operations — rowwise_map
text: rowwise_*() functions apply function row data.frame. input function .f single-row subset class. useful handling subclasses data.frame, sf. base::apply(.x, 1L, .f) converts input matrix. rowwise_mcmap*() parallelized versions rowwise_map*().
